article: It was the second time that I have been to the hospital. _ it was a weekday, there were still lots of people there, which _ me at first. Most of us live healthy lives, so perhaps we never realize that there are so many people going through pain and torment. As I walked along the hallway, I saw a variety of people and felt many things _ through my mind. I heard a small laugh of joy and _ my head to see what had happened. A woman was standing in the hallway, saying to her husband beside: " _ is okay! Your baby is moving around like always in my belly ." The man smiled and said: "Our child must have a _ like mine." They smiled at each other and walked _ away. A small new _ makes so many people so happy. I was _ why my parents always looked so _ when I told them that I felt unwell. Parents _ their children's lives more dearly than their own. Another noise. I heard a nurse say: "We are _ the operation. Don't worry." An operation is something that I have feared ever since _ . I fear the _ of it. If an operation is _ , everybody is happy. But if not, the world seems to _ . After all, we know the people around us will leave our world _ . Facing the forces of life and death, we are as _ as drops of water in an ocean, only there to be pushed back and forth. I felt myself grow up in that exact moment and place, in my deepest thoughts.
